title: password recovery from old hard drive
content: I had a laptop die on me suddenly without knowing about Firefox sync, the laptops hard drive still worked but I didn't have a way to access it for about 10 months until now. on a new laptop I have set up a new Firefox profile and either set up new passwords or or opened new accounts on some of the websites but a lot of old logins and browsing data, and bookmarks. now that I can access the old profile on the old hard drive I was trying to see if I could just recover missing passwords or data from the old to new profile but on the support website all I can find seems to be how to overwrite the the new profile with the old one which would mean losing a chunk of new passwords and data. it is also unclear whether any new backup or syncs of the new profile would remain or be wiped with the overwrite, is there a way to view the old profiles data to recover parts piecemeal or is the only option to overwrite the new profile. I apologize if this is a lack of computer literacy.

title: Logins --bugs and bad designs
content:
I rarely login to Firefox, or Mozilla, but with the demand that all Pocket users must use Firefox/Mozilla logins from now on, I have tried to use the F/M logins, but it's really not working very well, see below.

1) The main login page for F/M is: https://accounts.firefox.com/

1a) Doesn't it make sense to have the login at the Mozilla level, here: https://www.mozilla.org/en-US/ ?

1b) OK, since it is at the Firefox level, the login page is driving me nuts. I use Norton Password Mgr and nothing shows up on this page to get Norton to fill in the blanks for me. Is there something actively blocking accounts.firefox.com -- a.ff.com that prevents an overlay from Norton PW Mgr?

1c) Once I paste my PW into that area, I arrive on https://accounts.firefox.com/settings that is a nutty homepage. Please choose anything else except the settings page that has a big red "Delete Account" on it at the bottom.

1d) So on the settings page there is a section that says: "Connected Services." Hey, I see Pocket! Great, I click on Pocket and.... well it sends me to a Pocket page where I am not logged on???? What? I am logged on to a.ff.com so why wouldn't you pass the PW under the covers to have me logged in when I click from a secure page in ff? Make it easy for us users, please.

1e) I believe a federated website is in order. If I am logged into a.ff.com then why am I not logged into Pocket automatically and with no effort by me, when I arrive at the Pocket website? This is relatively easy to do under the covers to make it... easier for the user.

2) OK, now I am moving over to Pocket's website, but since F/M owns pocket, I think I am still in the correct support page.

2a) I logged into M/F and then bring up another browser tab and go to Pocket. I should be logged into Pocket as stated above. I am not. So, I try to use Norton PW Mgr again. Hey, the Norton PW-M overwrite is there! Yeah! I click on it, it fills in my ID, Yea! I click on it again it fills in my PW. Great! I click Login and, nothing. I try again to login, nothing. I type my ID and paste in my 16-digit password with random symbols, numbers and u/l case letter, nothing. Why is this not working? Here is the bug: cannot log in to Pocket with my ID and PW.

2b) I go back to a.ff.com > Settings > Connected Services and see that a.ff.com thinks that I logged in to Pocket a few minutes ago? Really? Well Pocket does not think I am logged in??? I go up to the 3x3 squares in the upper right-hand corner and select Pocket, nope, that does not get me logged in either. I look at this Pocket website (https://getpocket.com/en/pocket-and-firefox/?src=ff_bento) and click on "Activate Pocket in Firefox" and it shows me the old a.ff.com login. I enter the PW and... wait... yes! I am logged in to Pocket.

2c) Clearly that was insane. I cry for my peers who like to read (with Pocket) and hate Chrome.

3) Please F/M people, tell me there are a bunch of bugs and design errors due to the absorption of Pocket's website and you have not had time to fix them yet?

4) Or, tell me what ff setting I change that blew my user experience out of the water?

Thanks. Rick.
creator: Rick-17

title: Did Not Connect: Potential Security Issue
content:
Did Not Connect: Potential Security Issue

Firefox detected a potential security threat and did not continue to nvsp.in because this website requires a secure connection.

What can you do about it?

nvsp.in has a security policy called HTTP Strict Transport Security (HSTS), which means that Firefox can only connect to it securely. You can’t add an exception to visit this site.

The issue is most likely with the website, and there is nothing you can do to resolve it.

If you are on a corporate network or using anti-virus software, you can reach out to the support teams for assistance. You can also notify the website’s administrator about the problem.

title: Disable Firefox Print Dialog Box.
content:
In earlier versions your print dialog box could be disabled with "print.tab_modal.enabled + true. In my Firefox version 97.0.1, that is not effective. PLEASE go back to allowing users to disable the Firefox print dialog box. It is clumsy, retains print settings that have to be changed each time a different document has to be printed, and creates a number of steps and wasted time for people who must routinely print from Firefox.

Why would Firefox go the way of other software companies and have no one to contact about this other than community (no offense to the "community") and disable the option to remove the Firefox print dialog box? None of this is the user friendly Firefox I have come to know!

Suzy

title: HTML5 video file not found
content: I have been running into this problem where video's on a site will suddenly start having this "HTML5 video file not found". The confusing this is that it's happening on sites where I was able to actually watch the video just a few seconds before, then I'll browse a few pages then suddenly all the video will show this. I click on the video, it will actually show it for a split second, then shows the "HTML5 video file not found". Most of the time I have to clear cookies, shut down Firefox, and in some cases even restart my PC before it fixes itself. But on some sites, it takes month's before it will suddenly work again. I don't understand why this keeps happening? I've googled fixes for this, and not a single one ever works. Is this a flaw with the Firefox browser, or the websites? Is there a way to stop this from happening because it's incredibly annoying?
